title: unexpected sum() of bytetensor
body_html:
when use:
torch.eye(4, 4).byte().cuda().repeat(64, 1, 1).sum()
Returns
0
[torch.cuda.ByteTensor of size () (GPU 0)]

Similarly,
torch.eye(5, 5).byte().cuda().repeat(64, 1, 1).sum()
64
[torch.cuda.ByteTensor of size () (GPU 0)]

torch.eye(10, 10).byte().cuda().repeat(64, 1, 1).sum()
128
[torch.cuda.ByteTensor of size () (GPU 0)]

torch.eye(10, 10).byte().cuda().repeat(64, 1, 1)[0:20].sum()
200
[torch.cuda.ByteTensor of size () (GPU 0)]

When submitting a bug report, please include the following information (where relevant):

  • OS: Ubuntu 17.10
  • PyTorch version: 0.4.0a0+7588893
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Python version: 3.6.3
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0.61/7101
  • GPU models and configuration: GTX 1080TI
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 4.8.5
